23 | > 24 | 27 | { digest: '3769315134' } GET / 500 in 194ms ⚠ ./src/app/page.tsx Attempted import error: 'ShieldIcon' is not exported from '@radix-ui/react-icons' (imported as 'ShieldIcon'). Import trace for requested module: ./src/app/page.tsx ./src/app/page.tsx Attempted import error: 'UsersIcon' is not exported from '@radix-ui/react-icons' (imported as 'UsersIcon'). Import trace for requested module: ./src/app/page.tsx GET / 200 in 2ms React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You like ly forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports. React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You like ly forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports. ⨯ [Error: Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. Yo u likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.] { digest: '345934820' } React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. Yo u likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.] { digest: '345934820' } GET / 500 in 383ms React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You like ly forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports. React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You like ly forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports. ⨯ [Error: Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. Yo u likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.] { digest: '345934820' } GET / 500 in 239ms ```tsx numberproxy/src/app/page.tsx import Link from "next/link"; import { Container, Heading, Text, Button, Flex, Card, Grid, Box, } from "@radix-ui/themes"; import { ShieldIcon, UsersIcon, SwitchIcon, BellIcon, } from "@radix-ui/react-icons"; const features = [ { icon: ShieldIcon, title: "Privacy Protection", description: "Keep your real phone number private when signing up for services and rewards programs.", }, { icon: UsersIcon, title: "Family Coordination", description: "Forward messages to multiple family members to ensure everyone stays in the loop.", }, { icon: SwitchIcon, title: "Smart Forwarding", description: "Automatically route messages to your real number without revealing it to senders.", }, { icon: BellIcon, title: "Instant Notifications", description: "Get notifications on your real number as soon as messages arrive at your proxy number.", }, ]; export default function Home() { return (
{/* Hero Section */} Protect Your Privacy with{" "} Smart SMS Forwarding Create virtual phone numbers that forward messages to you while keeping your real number private. Perfect for online shopping, rewards programs, and family coordination. {/* Features Section */} Why Choose NumberProxy? {features.map((feature, index) => ( {feature.title} {feature.description} ))}
); } ``` how can I fix the errors we're getting here? Okay, so I'm trying to figure out how to fix the errors in this React application. Let me start by looking at the terminal output and the code provided. First, the terminal shows a ReferenceError: Button is not defined at src/app/page.tsx:24:15. That means the Button component isn't being imported correctly. Looking at the import statement, I see it's importing from "@radix-ui/themes". Wait, Radix UI's themes package probably doesn't include components like Button. I think the components are in a different package, maybe "@radix-ui/react-button". Next, there are errors about ShieldIcon and UsersIcon not being exported from '@radix-ui/react-icons'. That suggests that either the icons aren't exported from that module or they're named differently. Maybe I need to check if those specific icons are available in the react-icons package or if their names have changed. Then, there's a React.jsx error saying that the component type is invalid because it's undefined. This likely ties back to the import issues—since Button isn't imported correctly, it's undefined when used. So, my plan is: 1. Fix the Button import by changing the source from "@radix-ui/themes" to "@radix-ui/react-button". 2. Check if ShieldIcon and UsersIcon are available in '@radix-ui/react-icons'. If not, maybe they need to be imported from a different package or their names might be different. 3. Ensure all other components like Flex, Card, etc., are correctly imported from the right packages. I'll start by correcting the Button import. Then, I'll verify each icon's availability and adjust the imports accordingly. This should resolve the undefined component errors and the ReferenceError. The errors in your code are due to incorrect imports and missing exports. Here's how to fix them: 1. **Incorrect Button Import**: - The `Button` component isn't exported from `"@radix-ui/themes"`. Instead, it's part of the Radix UI primitives. 2. **Missing Icon Exports**: - `ShieldIcon`, `UsersIcon`, and other icons aren't directly exported from `'@radix-ui/react-icons'`. You need to import them specifically. Here are the corrected imports: ```tsx import Link from "next/link"; // Import components from Radix UI primitives import { Container, Heading, Text, } from "@radix-ui/layout"; import { Button } from "@radix-ui/react-button"; import { Flex } from "@radix-ui/react-flex"; import { Card, Grid, Box } from "@radix-ui/react-card"; // Import icons specifically from '@radix-ui/react-icons' import * as Icons from "@radix-ui/react-icons"; const { ShieldIcon, UsersIcon, SwitchIcon, BellIcon, } = Icons; ``` Then, update your feature array to use the icons correctly: ```tsx const features = [ { icon: ShieldIcon, title: "Privacy Protection", description: "Keep your real phone number private when signing up for services and rewards programs.", }, // ... rest of the features ]; ``` Also, ensure you've installed all necessary Radix UI packages: ```bash npm install @radix-ui/react-button @radix-ui/react-icons @radix-ui/layout @radix-ui/react-flex @radix-ui/react-card ``` **Explanation:** - **Button Import**: Changed to `@radix-ui/react-button`. - **Icons**: Imported all icons from `@radix-ui/react-icons` and then destructured the specific ones needed. - **Layout Components**: Separated layout components into their respective packages for clarity. These changes should resolve the undefined component errors you're encountering.
summary: <think>Okay, let's see. The user provided some terminal output with errors and their page.tsx file. They're asking how to fix these errors.
